# motionKeyframeCount

**Instance Property**

The number of keyframes in the geometry data.

## Declaration

```swift
var motionKeyframeCount: Int { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value is `1`. If the value is greater than `1`, all geometry descriptors that you attach to this descriptor need to be motion descriptors, and each needs to have exactly that many [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLMotionKeyframeData] objects.

## Related Documentation

- **geometryDescriptors**: An array that contains the individual pieces of geometry that compose the acceleration structure.

## Specifying motion behavior

- **motionStartTime**: The start time for the range of motion that the keyframe data describes.
- **motionEndTime**: The end time for the range of motion that the keyframe data describes.
- **motionStartBorderMode**: The mode to use when handling timestamps before the start time.
- **motionEndBorderMode**: The mode to use when handling timestamps after the end time.
- **MTLMotionBorderMode**: Options for specifying how the acceleration structure handles timestamps that are outside the specified range.
